comments.body: This is going to increase time for even our 100-node presubmit. Did you measure how much increase there is?

E.g. in https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/ci-kubernetes-e2e-gci-gce-scalability/16218/build-log.txt latency measuring takes 20 seconds.

Here I'm starting this code 4 more times, so it should increase time by ~1.5 minute (runs usually takes ~40 minutes), so I think it should be fine.
Ok, I believe we can live with that.

Actually, I just looked at those logs and it seems like the whole batch (creation+watch+deletion) take about ~40s (from 08:17:05 -> 08:17:46). So the increase would actually be ~3 minutes :)

That said, it's still sth we can probably live with.
Yes, you are right. I missed pod deletion.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +700,704 @@				// Pick latencyPodsIterations so that:
				// latencyPodsIterations * nodeCount >= MinPodStartupMeasurements.
				latencyPodsIterations := (MinPodStartupMeasurements + nodeCount - 1) / nodeCount
				By(fmt.Sprintf("Scheduling additional %d Pods to measure startup latencies", latencyPodsIterations*nodeCount))

comments.body: Please also add a `printPodAllocationPhase.End()` at the end of the code block like others. We don't want this to break in future if we add more code below this.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +280,284 @@
	printPodAllocationPhase := testPhaseDurations.StartPhase(400, "printing pod allocation")
	defer printPodAllocationPhase.End()
	// Print some data about Pod to Node allocation
	By("Printing Pod to Node allocation data")
